intro: Hibbertia recurvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in spring and summer. Hibbertia recurvifolia is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained sandy soils. It is a hardy species that is often used in native gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability.
